Macbook Pro 13" mid-2012, 4GB RAM, Intel HD 4000 512MB
@mjchch, try to click it many times
@noobnak, I have force re-check. I have clicked it many time, but it won't play. As soon I clicked the game, it just directly dismissed. :(

@mjchch
right click on the game and chose show package contents
-double click on WINESKIN and chose SET SCREEN OPTIONS
-enable "use mac driver instead of X11"(right side)
-Quit and launch the game

hello, thanks for the upload, but i'm afraid there are several problems:

1) the game could not be archived with any other program than The Unarchiver (but i finally managed to unzip the game in applications);

2) I changed the screen settings in Wineskin and enabled the following option: ''Use Mac Driver instead of X11'' - nothing happens, the game doesn't even pop up.

3) in case i disable the above mentioned option and enable override, the game pops up, but then a black screen appears and the game crashes.

Therefore, could you please explain the proper screen settings for Wineskin (including override settings - if required, what other options to enable etc.)

thanks again
noobnak, did you receive my previous comment?

noobnak, thanks for the directions. They're not working for me, but I'm posting here to see whether others have had similar problems 

As others have indicated, Archive Utility fails to uncompress the archive. 

Unarchiver seems to work, in that it creates a normal-looking application. This app fails to launch. When I attempt to Show Package Contents, the Wineskin app initially indicated that it was corrupted (I can't reproduce the exact error message; now it just bounces and fails to launch).

Anyone else having similar problems? Any idea about how to fix them?

I'll try uncompressing the file again, just to see if that works, but I'm not optimistic.
